SIGN.name: SIGN
SIGN.detail: Absolute value of x with sign of y. y=0 results in positive sign.

CXABS.name: CXABS
CXABS.detail: Absolute value of the complex number x + yi ( ![](ans_apdl/graphics/eqbf4dc69f-1367-4dc0-8baf-5f412d4b4e2e.svg))

MOD.name: MOD
MOD.detail: Remainder of x/y, computed as x - (INT(x/y) * y). y=0 returns zero (0).

RAND.name: RAND
RAND.detail: Random number (uniform distribution) in the range x to y (x = lower bound, y = upper bound).

GDIS.name: GDIS
GDIS.detail: Random sample of a Gaussian (normal) distribution with mean x and standard deviation y.

SIN.name: SIN
SIN.detail: Sine, Cosine, and Tangent of x. x is in radians by default, but can be changed to degrees with [*AFUN](ans_cmd/Hlp_C_AFUN.html).

COS.name: COS
COS.detail: Sine, Cosine, and Tangent of x. x is in radians by default, but can be changed to degrees with [*AFUN](ans_cmd/Hlp_C_AFUN.html).

TAN.name: TAN
TAN.detail: Sine, Cosine, and Tangent of x. x is in radians by default, but can be changed to degrees with [*AFUN](ans_cmd/Hlp_C_AFUN.html).

SINH.name: SINH
SINH.detail: Hyperbolic sine, Hyperbolic cosine, and Hyperbolic tangent of x.

COSH.name: COSH
COSH.detail: Hyperbolic sine, Hyperbolic cosine, and Hyperbolic tangent of x.

TANH.name: TANH
TANH.detail: Hyperbolic sine, Hyperbolic cosine, and Hyperbolic tangent of x.

ASIN.name: ASIN
ASIN.detail: Arcsine, Arccosine, and Arctangent of x. x must be between -1.0 and +1.0 for ASIN and ACOS. Output is in radians by default, but can be changed to degrees with [*AFUN](ans_cmd/Hlp_C_AFUN.html). Range of output is -pi/2 to +pi/2 for ASIN and ATAN, and 0 to pi for ACOS.

ACOS.name: ACOS
ACOS.detail: Arcsine, Arccosine, and Arctangent of x. x must be between -1.0 and +1.0 for ASIN and ACOS. Output is in radians by default, but can be changed to degrees with [*AFUN](ans_cmd/Hlp_C_AFUN.html). Range of output is -pi/2 to +pi/2 for ASIN and ATAN, and 0 to pi for ACOS.

ATAN.name: ATAN
ATAN.detail: Arcsine, Arccosine, and Arctangent of x. x must be between -1.0 and +1.0 for ASIN and ACOS. Output is in radians by default, but can be changed to degrees with [*AFUN](ans_cmd/Hlp_C_AFUN.html). Range of output is -pi/2 to +pi/2 for ASIN and ATAN, and 0 to pi for ACOS.

ATAN2.name: ATAN2
ATAN2.detail: Arctangent of y/x with the sign of each component considered. Output is in radians by default, but can be changed to degrees with [*AFUN](ans_cmd/Hlp_C_AFUN.html). Range of output is -pi to +pi.

VALCHR.name: VALCHR
VALCHR.detail: a8 is a decimal value expressed in a string.

CHRVAL.name: CHRVAL
CHRVAL.detail: Character value of numerical parameter PARM. Number of decimal places depends on magnitude.

LARGEINT.name: LARGEINT
LARGEINT.detail: Forms a 64-bit pointer from low (x) and high (y) 32-bit integers.

NDNEXT.name: NDNEXT
NDNEXT.detail: Next selected node having a node number greater than N.

ELNEXT.name: ELNEXT
ELNEXT.detail: Next selected element having an element number greater than E.

KPNEXT.name: KPNEXT
KPNEXT.detail: Next selected keypoint having a keypoint number greater than K.

LSNEXT.name: LSNEXT
LSNEXT.detail: Next selected line having a line number greater than L.

ARNEXT.name: ARNEXT
ARNEXT.detail: Next selected area having an area number greater than A.

VLNEXT.name: VLNEXT
VLNEXT.detail: Next selected volume having a volume number greater than V.

CENTRX.name: CENTRX
CENTRX.detail: Centroid X-coordinate of element E in global Cartesian coordinate system. Centroid is determined from the selected nodes on the element.

CENTRY.name: CENTRY
CENTRY.detail: Centroid Y-coordinate of element E in global Cartesian coordinate system. Centroid is determined from the selected nodes on the element.

CENTRZ.name: CENTRZ
CENTRZ.detail: Centroid Z-coordinate of element E in global Cartesian coordinate system. Centroid is determined from the selected nodes on the element.

NX.name: NX
NX.detail: X-coordinate of node N in the active coordinate system.

NY.name: NY
NY.detail: Y-coordinate of node N in the active coordinate system.

NZ.name: NZ
NZ.detail: Z-coordinate of node N in the active coordinate system.

KX.name: KX
KX.detail: X-coordinate of keypoint K in the active coordinate system

KY.name: KY
KY.detail: Y-coordinate of keypoint K in the active coordinate system

KZ.name: KZ
KZ.detail: Z-coordinate of keypoint K in the active coordinate system

LX.name: LX
LX.detail: X-coordinate of line L at length fraction LFRAC (0.0 to 1.0).

LY.name: LY
LY.detail: Y-coordinate of line L at length fraction LFRAC (0.0 to 1.0).

LZ.name: LZ
LZ.detail: Z-coordinate of line L at length fraction LFRAC (0.0 to 1.0).

LSX.name: LSX
LSX.detail: X slope of line L at length fraction LFRAC (0.0 to 1.0).

LSY.name: LSY
LSY.detail: Y slope of line L at length fraction LFRAC (0.0 to 1.0).

LSZ.name: LSZ
LSZ.detail: Z slope of line L at length fraction LFRAC (0.0 to 1.0).

NODE.name: NODE
NODE.detail: Number of the selected node nearest the X,Y,Z point (in the active coordinate system, lowest number for coincident nodes). A number higher than the highest node number indicates that the node is internal (generated by program).

KP.name: KP
KP.detail: Number of the selected keypoint nearest the X,Y,Z point (in the active coordinate system, lowest number for coincident keypoints).

DISTND.name: DISTND
DISTND.detail: Distance between nodes N1 and N2.

DISTKP.name: DISTKP
DISTKP.detail: Distance between keypoints K1 and K2.

DISTEN.name: DISTEN
DISTEN.detail: Distance between the centroid of element E and node N. Centroid is determined from the selected nodes on the element.

ANGLEN.name: ANGLEN
ANGLEN.detail: Subtended angle between two lines (defined by three nodes where N1 is the vertex node). Default is in radians.

ANGLEK.name: ANGLEK
ANGLEK.detail: Subtended angle between two lines (defined by three keypoints where K1 is the vertex keypoint). Default is in radians.

ENEARN.name: ENEARN
ENEARN.detail: Selected element nearest node N. The element position is calculated from the selected nodes.

AREAND.name: AREAND
AREAND.detail: Area of the triangle with vertices at nodes N1, N2, and N3.

AREAKP.name: AREAKP
AREAKP.detail: Area of the triangle with vertices at keypoints K1, K2, and K3.

ARNODE.name: ARNODE
ARNODE.detail: Area at node N apportioned from selected elements attached to node N. For 2-D planar solids, returns edge area associated with the node. For axisymmetric solids, returns edge surface area associated with the node. For 3-D volumetric solids, returns face area associated with the node. For 3â€“D, select all the nodes of the surface of interest before using ARNODE.

NORMNX.name: NORMNX
NORMNX.detail: X-direction cosine of the normal to the plane containing nodes N1, N2, and N3, reported in the global Cartesian coordinate system.

NORMNY.name: NORMNY
NORMNY.detail: Y-direction cosine of the normal to the plane containing nodes N1, N2, and N3, reported in the global Cartesian coordinate system.

NORMNZ.name: NORMNZ
NORMNZ.detail: Z-direction cosine of the normal to the plane containing nodes N1, N2, and N3, reported in the global Cartesian coordinate system.

NORMKX.name: NORMKX
NORMKX.detail: X-direction cosine of the normal to the plane containing keypoints K1, K2, and K3, reported in the global Cartesian coordinate system.

NORMKY.name: NORMKY
NORMKY.detail: Y-direction cosine of the normal to the plane containing keypoints K1, K2, and K3, reported in the global Cartesian coordinate system.

NORMKZ.name: NORMKZ
NORMKZ.detail: Z-direction cosine of the normal to the plane containing keypoints K1, K2, and K3, reported in the global Cartesian coordinate system.

ENEXTN.name: ENEXTN
ENEXTN.detail: Element connected to node N. LOC is the position in the resulting list when many elements share the node. A zero is returned at the end of the list.

NELEM.name: NELEM
NELEM.detail: Node number in position NPOS (1--20) of element E.

NODEDOF.name: NODEDOF
NODEDOF.detail:
Returns the bit pattern for the active DOFs at the specified node.

bit 0 is UX, bit 1 is UY,... bit 5 is ROTZ

bit 8 is AZ

bits 9,10,11 are VX,VY,VZ

bit 18 is PRES, bit 19 is TEMP, bit 20 is VOLT, bit 21 is MAG

bit 24 is EMF, bit 25 is CURR

For a node with UX,UY,UZ the return value will be 7 (bits 0,1,2)

For a node with UX,UY,UZ,ROTX,ROTY,ROTZ the return value will be 63 (bits 0,1,2,3,4,5)

ELADJ.name: ELADJ
ELADJ.detail: For 2-D planar solids and 3-D volumetric solids, element adjacent to a face (FACE) of element E. The face number is the same as the surface load key number. Only elements of the same dimensionality and shape are considered. A -1 is returned if more than one is adjacent.

NDFACE.name: NDFACE
NDFACE.detail: Node in position LOC of a face number FACE of element E. The face number is the same as the surface load key number. LOC is the nodal position on the face (for an IJLK face, LOC=1 is at node I, 2 is at node J, etc.)

NMFACE.name: NMFACE
NMFACE.detail: Face number of element E containing the selected nodes. The face number output is the surface load key. If multiple load keys occur on a face (such as for line and area elements) the lowest load key for that face is output.

ARFACE.name: ARFACE
ARFACE.detail: For 2-D planar solids and 3-D volumetric solids, returns the area of the face of element E containing the selected nodes. For axisymmetric elements, the area is the full (360 degree) area.

EATT.name: EATT
EATT.detail: Element attribute number assigned to element E. Use VAL = 1 for MATT, 2 for TYPE, 3 for REAL, and 4 for SECN.

RCON.name: RCON
RCON.detail: Real constant value for real table R and location LOC.

SECTOMAT.name: SECTOMAT
SECTOMAT.detail: Material ID to be used for general contact between sections Sect1 and Sect2.

SECTOREAL.name: SECTOREAL
SECTOREAL.detail: Real constant ID to be used for general contact between sections Sect1 and Sect2.

UX.name: UX
UX.detail: UX structural displacement at node N.

UY.name: UY
UY.detail: UY structural displacement at node N.

UZ.name: UZ
UZ.detail: UZ structural displacement at node N.

ROTX.name: ROTX
ROTX.detail: ROTX structural rotation at node N.

ROTY.name: ROTY
ROTY.detail: ROTY structural rotation at node N.

ROTZ.name: ROTZ
ROTZ.detail: ROTZ structural rotation at node N.

TEMP.name: TEMP
TEMP.detail: Temperature at node N. For [SHELL131](ans_elem/Hlp_E_SHELL131.html) and [SHELL132](ans_elem/Hlp_E_SHELL132.html) elements with KEYOPT(3) = 0 or 1, use TBOT(N), TE2(N), TE3(N), . . ., TTOP(N) instead of TEMP(N).

VX.name: VX
VX.detail: VX fluid velocity at node N.

VY.name: VY
VY.detail: VY fluid velocity at node N.

VZ.name: VZ
VZ.detail: VZ fluid velocity at node N.

MAG.name: MAG
MAG.detail: Magnetic scalar potential at node N.

AZ.name: AZ
AZ.detail: AZ magnetic vector potential at node N.

KWGET.name: KWGET
KWGET.detail: Returns the current value the keyword specified by KEYWORD.

VALHEX.name: VALHEX
VALHEX.detail: a8 is a hex value expressed in a string.

STRSUB.name: STRSUB
STRSUB.detail: Get the nChar substring starting at character nLoc in Str1.

STRCAT.name: STRCAT
STRCAT.detail: Add Str2 at the end of Str1.

STRFILL.name: STRFILL
STRFILL.detail: Add Str2 to Str1 starting at character nLoc.

STRPOS.name: STRPOS
STRPOS.detail: Get starting location of Str2 in Str1.

SPLIT.name: SPLIT
SPLIT.detail: Produces a separate output of the file extension from the pathstring.
